body: hi @esiqveland , I don't remember seeing a project with this kind of thing... can you point some, so I can see how they do it?

I was trying to think of the same thing, and I know I have seen it before, but I couldn't come up with any good examples!

I know some publish signatures for their artifacts in the java (maven) eco-system, as well as most linux distributions publish signatures for their packages so they can be verified before installing.

I'll see if I can come up with something better.
Yeah, I kind of remember have seeing something like that somewhere, don't remember where though ðŸ˜†

Some examples:

Maven Plugin: http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-gpg-plugin/

Debian: https://wiki.debian.org/Creating%20signed%20GitHub%20releases

Didn't have more time to look further into it right now!
hmm, so, basically, call `gpg --armor --detach-sign` for each artifact and upload the `artifact.asc` file...

Yes, so if it is gpg based, one would probably have to configure the key id to sign with.
This should be your gpg publish key id.

I think there is a lib for go that could do this signing, so it doesn't have to depend on gpg executable.
I believe https://godoc.org/golang.org/x/crypto/openpgp would serve this nicely.

issue.title: WIP: Adds GPG signing pipeline
issue.body:
This is WiP, (state works for me)

Just like to get ideas that need to be supported in config other than the key id. I can look after tests and and documentation then.

Fixes #166

body:
FWIW, I'm signing the checksum file with GPG for https://github.com/fabiolb/fabio. I'm looking into using goreleaser now since it's super useful but that's missing. I can work around this though until the feature is there.
GitHub
fabiolb/fabio
fabio - A fast, modern, zero-conf load balancing HTTP(S) router for deploying microservices managed by consul.

issue.title: feat: add artifact signing pipeline
issue.body:
This patch adds a generic artifact signing pipeline.

This is a replacement for both #420 and #452 and this implementation relies on the tools the user has already installed.

Need to add a test.

Closes #420 
Closes #452 
Fixes #166

body: This issue has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
